Title: The Shawshank Redemption
Plots: Over the course of several years, two convicts form a friendship, seeking consolation and, eventually, redemption through basic compassion.

Title: The Godfather
Plots: The aging patriarch of an organized crime dynasty transfers control of his clandestine empire to his reluctant son.

Title: The Dark Knight
Plots: When the menace known as the Joker wreaks havoc and chaos on the people of Gotham, Batman must accept one of the greatest psychological and physical tests of his ability to fight injustice.

Title: The Godfather Part II
Plots: The early life and career of Vito Corleone in 1920s New York City is portrayed, while his son, Michael, expands and tightens his grip on the family crime syndicate.

Title: 12 Angry Men
Plots: The jury in a New York City murder trial is frustrated by a single member whose skeptical caution forces them to more carefully consider the evidence before jumping to a hasty verdict.

Title: Schindler's List
Plots: In German-occupied Poland during World War II, industrialist Oskar Schindler gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
Plots: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

Title: Pulp Fiction
Plots: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
Plots: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

Title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
Plots: A bounty hunting scam joins two men in an uneasy alliance against a third in a race to find a fortune in gold buried in a remote cemetery.

Title: Forrest Gump
Plots: The history of the United States from the 1950s to the '70s unfolds from the perspective of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, who yearns to be reunited with his childhood sweetheart.

Title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
Plots: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.

Title: Fight Club
Plots: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soap maker form an underground fight club that evolves into much more.

Title: Inception
Plots: A thief who steals corporate secrets through the use of dream-sharing technology is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a C.E.O., but his tragic past may doom the project and his team to disaster.

Title: Dune: Part Two
Plots: Paul Atreides unites with Chani and the Fremen while seeking revenge against the conspirators who destroyed his family.

Title: Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back
Plots: After the Rebels are overpowered by the Empire, Luke Skywalker begins his Jedi training with Yoda, while his friends are pursued across the galaxy by Darth Vader and bounty hunter Boba Fett.

Title: The Matrix
Plots: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

Title: GoodFellas
Plots: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mafia, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito.

Title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Plots: In the Fall of 1963, a Korean War veteran and criminal pleads insanity and is admitted to a mental institution, where he rallies up the scared patients against the tyrannical nurse.

Title: Seven
Plots: Two detectives, a rookie and a veteran, hunt a serial killer who uses the seven deadly sins as his motives.

Title: Interstellar
Plots: When Earth becomes uninhabitable in the future, a farmer and ex-NASA pilot, Joseph Cooper, is tasked to pilot a spacecraft, along with a team of researchers, to find a new planet for humans.

Title: It's a Wonderful Life
Plots: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

Title: Seven Samurai
Plots: Farmers from a village exploited by bandits hire a veteran samurai for protection, who gathers six other samurai to join him.

Title: The Silence of the Lambs
Plots: A young F.B.I. cadet must receive the help of an incarcerated and manipulative cannibal killer to help catch another serial killer, a madman who skins his victims.

Title: Saving Private Ryan
Plots: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

Title: City of God
Plots: In the slums of Rio, two kids' paths diverge as one struggles to become a photographer and the other a kingpin.

Title: Life Is Beautiful
Plots: When an open-minded Jewish waiter and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

Title: The Green Mile
Plots: A tale set on death row, where gentle giant John Coffey possesses the mysterious power to heal people's ailments. When the lead guard, Paul Edgecombe, recognizes John's gift, he tries to help stave off the condemned man's execution.

Title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
Plots: A cyborg, identical to the one who failed to kill Sarah Connor, must now protect her ten year old son John from an even more advanced and powerful cyborg.

Title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope
Plots: Luke Skywalker joins forces with a Jedi Knight, a cocky pilot, a Wookiee and two droids to save the galaxy from the Empire's world-destroying battle station, while also attempting to rescue Princess Leia from the mysterious Darth Vader.

Title: Back to the Future
Plots: Marty McFly, a 17-year-old high school student, is accidentally sent 30 years into the past in a time-traveling DeLorean invented by his close friend, the maverick scientist Doc Brown.

Title: Spirited Away
Plots: During her family's move to the suburbs, a sullen 10-year-old girl wanders into a world ruled by gods, witches and spirits, and where humans are changed into beasts.

Title: The Pianist
Plots: During WWII, acclaimed Polish musician Wladyslaw faces various struggles as he loses contact with his family. As the situation worsens, he hides in the ruins of Warsaw in order to survive.

Title: Parasite
Plots: Greed and class discrimination threaten the newly-formed symbiotic relationship between the wealthy Park family and the destitute Kim clan.

Title: Psycho
Plots: A Phoenix secretary embezzles $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.

Title: Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse
Plots: Miles Morales catapults across the multiverse, where he encounters a team of Spider-People charged with protecting its very existence. When the heroes clash on how to handle a new threat, Miles must redefine what it means to be a hero.

Title: Gladiator
Plots: A former Roman General sets out to exact vengeance against the corrupt emperor who murdered his family and sent him into slavery.

Title: The Lion King
Plots: Lion prince Simba and his father are targeted by his bitter uncle, who wants to ascend the throne himself.

Title: Leon
Plots: 12-year-old Mathilda is reluctantly taken in by Léon, a professional assassin, after her family is murdered. An unusual relationship forms as she becomes his protégée and learns the assassin's trade.

Title: The Departed
Plots: An undercover cop and a mole in the police attempt to identify each other while infiltrating an Irish gang in South Boston.

Title: American History X
Plots: Living a life marked by violence, neo-Nazi Derek finally goes to prison after killing two black youths. Upon his release, Derek vows to change; he hopes to prevent his brother, Danny, who idolizes Derek, from following in his footsteps.

Title: Whiplash
Plots: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

Title: The Prestige
Plots: After a tragic accident, two stage magicians in 1890s London engage in a battle to create the ultimate illusion while sacrificing everything they have to outwit each other.

Title: Grave of the Fireflies
Plots: A young boy and his little sister struggle to survive in Japan during World War II.

Title: Harakiri
Plots: When a ronin requesting seppuku at a feudal lord's palace is told of the brutal suicide of another ronin who previously visited, he reveals how their pasts are intertwined - and in doing so challenges the clan's integrity.

Title: The Usual Suspects
Plots: The sole survivor of a pier shoot-out tells the story of how a notorious criminal influenced the events that began with five criminals meeting in a seemingly random police lineup.

Title: Casablanca
Plots: A cynical expatriate American cafe owner struggles to decide whether or not to help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape the Nazis in French Morocco.

Title: Untouchable
Plots: After he becomes a quadriplegic from a paragliding accident, an aristocrat hires a young man from the projects to be his caregiver.

Title: Cinema Paradiso
Plots: A filmmaker recalls his childhood when falling in love with the pictures at the cinema of his home village and forms a deep friendship with the cinema's projectionist.

Title: Modern Times
Plots: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.

Title: Rear Window
Plots: A wheelchair-bound photographer spies on his neighbors from his Greenwich Village courtyard apartment window and, despite the skepticism of his fashion-model girlfriend, becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.

Title: Once Upon a Time in the West
Plots: A mysterious stranger with a harmonica joins forces with a notorious desperado to protect a beautiful widow from a ruthless assassin working for the railroad.

Title: Alien
Plots: The crew of a commercial spacecraft encounters a deadly lifeform after investigating a mysterious transmission of unknown origin.

Title: City Lights
Plots: With the aid of a wealthy erratic tippler, a dewy-eyed tramp who has fallen in love with a sightless flower girl accumulates money to be able to help her medically.

Title: Apocalypse Now
Plots: A U.S. Army officer serving in Vietnam is tasked with assassinating a renegade Special Forces Colonel who sees himself as a god.

Title: Django Unchained
Plots: With the help of a German bounty-hunter, a freed slave sets out to rescue his wife from a brutal plantation owner in Mississippi.

Title: Memento
Plots: A man with short-term memory loss attempts to track down his wife's murderer.

Title: 12th Fail
Plots: The real-life story of IPS Officer Manoj Kumar Sharma and IRS Officer Shraddha Joshi.

Title: WALL·E
Plots: In the distant future, a small waste-collecting robot inadvertently embarks on a space journey that will ultimately decide the fate of mankind.

Title: Raiders of the Lost Ark
Plots: In 1936, archaeologist and adventurer Indiana Jones is hired by the U.S. government to find the Ark of the Covenant before the Nazis can obtain its awesome powers.

Title: The Lives of Others
Plots: In 1984 East Berlin, an agent of the secret police conducting surveillance on a writer and his lover finds himself becoming increasingly absorbed by their lives.

Title: Sunset Blvd.
Plots: A screenwriter develops a dangerous relationship with a faded film star determined to make a triumphant return.

Title: Paths of Glory
Plots: After a failed attack on a German position, a general orders three soldiers, chosen at random, court-martialed for cowardice and their commanding officer must defend them.

Title: Avengers: Infinity War
Plots: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

Title: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
Plots: Teen Miles Morales becomes the Spider-Man of his universe and must join with five spider-powered individuals from other dimensions to stop a threat for all realities.

Title: Witness for the Prosecution
Plots: A veteran British barrister must defend his client in a murder trial that has surprise after surprise.

Title: The Shining
Plots: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where a sinister presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from both past and future.

Title: The Great Dictator
Plots: Dictator Adenoid Hynkel tries to expand his empire while a poor Jewish barber tries to avoid persecution from Hynkel's regime.

Title: Aliens
Plots: Decades after surviving the Nostromo incident, Ellen Ripley is sent out to re-establish contact with a terraforming colony but finds herself battling the Alien Queen and her offspring.

Title: Inglourious Basterds
Plots: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

Title: The Dark Knight Rises
Plots: Eight years after the Joker's reign of chaos, Batman is coerced out of exile with the assistance of the mysterious Selina Kyle in order to defend Gotham City from the vicious guerrilla terrorist Bane.

Title: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
Plots: An unhinged American general orders a bombing attack on the Soviet Union, triggering a path to nuclear holocaust that a war room full of politicians and generals frantically tries to stop.

Title: American Beauty
Plots: A sexually frustrated suburban father has a mid-life crisis after becoming infatuated with his daughter's best friend.

Title: Oldboy
Plots: After being kidnapped and imprisoned for fifteen years, Oh Dae-Su is released, only to find that he must track down his captor in five days.

Title: Coco
Plots: Aspiring musician Miguel, confronted with his family's ancestral ban on music, enters the Land of the Dead to find his great-great-grandfather, a legendary singer.

Title: Amadeus
Plots: The life, success and troubles of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, as told by Antonio Salieri, the contemporaneous composer who was deeply jealous of Mozart's talent and claimed to have murdered him.

Title: Toy Story
Plots: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman action figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's bedroom.

Title: Das Boot
Plots: A German U-boat stalks the frigid waters of the North Atlantic as its young crew experience the sheer terror and claustrophobic life of a submariner in World War II.

Title: Braveheart
Plots: Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.

Title: Avengers: Endgame
Plots: After the devastating events of Avengers: Infinity War (2018), the universe is in ruins. With the help of remaining allies, the Avengers assemble once more in order to reverse Thanos' actions and restore balance to the universe.

Title: Joker
Plots: During the 1980s, a failed stand-up comedian is driven insane and turns to a life of crime and chaos in Gotham City while becoming an infamous psychopathic crime figure.

Title: Princess Mononoke
Plots: On a journey to find the cure for a Tatarigami's curse, Ashitaka finds himself in the middle of a war between the forest gods and Tatara, a mining colony. In this quest he also meets San, the Mononoke Hime.

Title: Good Will Hunting
Plots: Will Hunting, a janitor at M.I.T., has a gift for mathematics, but needs help from a psychologist to find direction in his life.

Title: Your Name.
Plots: Two teenagers share a profound, magical connection upon discovering they are swapping bodies. Things manage to become even more complicated when the boy and girl decide to meet in person.

Title: Once Upon a Time in America
Plots: A former Prohibition-era Jewish gangster returns to the Lower East Side of Manhattan 35 years later, where he must once again confront the ghosts and regrets of his old life.

Title: High and Low
Plots: An executive of a Yokohama shoe company becomes a victim of extortion when his chauffeur's son is kidnapped by mistake and held for ransom.

Title: 3 Idiots
Plots: Two friends are searching for their long lost companion. They revisit their college days and recall the memories of their friend who inspired them to think differently, even as the rest of the world called them "idiots".

Title: Singin' in the Rain
Plots: A silent film star falls for a chorus girl just as he and his delusionally jealous screen partner are trying to make the difficult transition to talking pictures in 1920s Hollywood.

Title: Capernaum
Plots: While serving a five-year sentence for a violent crime, a 12-year-old boy sues his parents for neglect.

Title: Oppenheimer
Plots: The story of American scientist J. Robert Oppenheimer and his role in the development of the atomic bomb.

Title: Requiem for a Dream
Plots: The drug-induced utopias of four Coney Island people are shattered when their addictions run deep..

Title: Come and See
Plots: After finding an old rifle, a young boy joins the Soviet resistance movement against ruthless German forces and experiences the horrors of World War II.

Title: Toy Story 3
Plots: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.

Title: Star Wars: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi
Plots: After rescuing Han Solo from Jabba the Hutt, the Rebels attempt to destroy the second Death Star, while Luke struggles to help Darth Vader back from the dark side.

Title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Plots: When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories for ever.

Title: The Hunt
Plots: A teacher lives a lonely life, all the while struggling over his son's custody. His life slowly gets better as he finds love and receives good news from his son, but his new luck is about to be brutally shattered by an innocent little lie.

Title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
Plots: After uncovering a mysterious artifact buried beneath the Lunar surface, a spacecraft is sent to Jupiter to find its origins: a spacecraft manned by two men and the supercomputer HAL 9000.

Title: Reservoir Dogs
Plots: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

Title: Ikiru
Plots: A bureaucrat tries to find meaning in his life after he discovers he has terminal cancer.

Title: Lawrence of Arabia
Plots: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I in order to fight the Turks.

Title: The Apartment
Plots: A Manhattan insurance clerk tries to rise in his company by letting its executives use his apartment for trysts, but complications and a romance of his own ensue.

Title: North by Northwest
Plots: A New York City advertising executive goes on the run after being mistaken for a government agent by a group of foreign spies, and falls for a woman whose loyalties he begins to doubt.

Title: Citizen Kane
Plots: Following the death of publishing tycoon Charles Foster Kane, reporters scramble to uncover the meaning of his final utterance: 'Rosebud.'

Title: Incendies
Plots: Twins journey to the Middle East to discover their family history and fulfill their mother's last wishes.

Title: Vertigo
Plots: A former San Francisco police detective juggles wrestling with his personal demons and becoming obsessed with the hauntingly beautiful woman he has been hired to trail, who may be deeply disturbed.

Title: M
Plots: When the police in a German city are unable to catch a child-murderer, other criminals join in the manhunt.

Title: Double Indemnity
Plots: A Los Angeles insurance representative lets an alluring housewife seduce him into a scheme of insurance fraud and murder that arouses the suspicion of his colleague, an insurance investigator.

Title: Scarface
Plots: In 1980 Miami, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug cartel and succumbs to greed.

Title: Amélie
Plots: Despite being caught in her imaginative world, Amelie, a young waitress, decides to help people find happiness. Her quest to spread joy leads her on a journey where she finds true love.

Title: Full Metal Jacket
Plots: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.

Title: A Clockwork Orange
Plots: In the future, a sadistic gang leader is imprisoned and volunteers for a conduct-aversion experiment, but it doesn't go as planned.

Title: Heat
Plots: A group of high-end professional thieves start to feel the heat from the LAPD when they unknowingly leave a verbal clue at their latest heist.

Title: Up
Plots: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Plots: Atticus Finch, a widowed lawyer in Depression-era Alabama, defends a Black man against an undeserved rape charge, and tries to educate his young children against prejudice.

Title: The Sting
Plots: Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con.

Title: A Separation
Plots: A married couple are faced with a difficult decision - to improve the life of their child by moving to another country or to stay in Iran and look after a deteriorating parent who has Alzheimer's disease.

Title: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
Plots: In 1938, after his father goes missing while pursuing the Holy Grail, Indiana Jones finds himself up against the Nazis again to stop them from obtaining its powers.

Title: Die Hard
Plots: A New York City police officer tries to save his estranged wife and several others taken hostage by terrorists during a Christmas party at the Nakatomi Plaza in Los Angeles.

Title: Metropolis
Plots: In a futuristic city sharply divided between the working class and the city planners, the son of the city's mastermind falls in love with a working-class prophet who predicts the coming of a savior to mediate their differences.

Title: Like Stars on Earth
Plots: An eight-year-old boy is thought to be a lazy trouble-maker, until the new art teacher has the patience and compassion to discover the real problem behind his struggles in school.

Title: Snatch
Plots: Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.

Title: Hamilton
Plots: The real life of one of America's foremost founding fathers and first Secretary of the Treasury, Alexander Hamilton. Captured live on Broadway from the Richard Rodgers Theater with the original Broadway cast.

Title: L.A. Confidential
Plots: As corruption grows in 1950s Los Angeles, three policemen - one strait-laced, one brutal, and one sleazy - investigate a series of murders with their own brand of justice.

Title: Bicycle Thieves
Plots: In post-war Italy, a working-class man's bicycle is stolen, endangering his efforts to find work. He and his son set out to find it.

April 6th, 1917. As an infantry battalion assembles to wage war deep in enemy territory, two soldiers are assigned to race against time and deliver a message that will stop 1,600 men from walking straight into a deadly trap.

Title: Taxi Driver
Plots: A mentally unstable veteran works as a nighttime taxi driver in New York City, where the perceived decadence and sleaze fuels his urge for violent action.

Title: Downfall
Plots: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.

Title: Dangal
Plots: Former wrestler Mahavir Singh Phogat and his two wrestler daughters struggle towards glory at the Commonwealth Games in the face of societal oppression.

Title: For a Few Dollars More
Plots: Two bounty hunters with the same intentions team up to track down a gang of outlaws led by a psychotic Mexican bandit, who is plotting an audacious bank robbery.

Title: Batman Begins
Plots: After witnessing his parents' death, Bruce learns the art of fighting to confront injustice. When he returns to Gotham as Batman, he must stop a secret society that intends to destroy the city.

Title: The Wolf of Wall Street
Plots: Based on the true story of Jordan Belfort, from his rise to a wealthy stock-broker living the high life to his fall involving crime, corruption and the federal government.

Title: Some Like It Hot
Plots: After two male musicians witness a mob hit, they flee the state in an all-female band disguised as women, but further complications set in.

Title: Green Book
Plots: A working-class Italian-American bouncer becomes the driver for an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the 1960s American South.

Title: The Kid
Plots: The Tramp cares for an abandoned child, but events put their relationship in jeopardy.

Title: The Father
Plots: A man refuses all assistance from his daughter as he ages. As he tries to make sense of his changing circumstances, he begins to doubt his loved ones, his own mind and even the fabric of his reality.

Title: Judgment at Nuremberg
Plots: In 1948, an American court in occupied Germany tries four Nazis judged for war crimes.

Title: All About Eve
Plots: A seemingly timid but secretly ruthless ingénue insinuates herself into the lives of an aging Broadway star and her circle of theater friends.

Title: The Truman Show
Plots: An insurance salesman discovers his whole life is actually a reality TV show.

Title: Top Gun: Maverick
Plots: After thirty years, Maverick is still pushing the envelope as a top naval aviator, but must confront ghosts of his past when he leads TOP GUN's elite graduates on a mission that demands the ultimate sacrifice from those chosen to fly it.

Title: Shutter Island
Plots: Teddy Daniels and Chuck Aule, two US marshals, are sent to an asylum on a remote island in order to investigate the disappearance of a patient, where Teddy uncovers a shocking truth about the place.

Title: There Will Be Blood
Plots: A story of family, religion, hatred, oil and madness, focusing on a turn-of-the-century prospector in the early days of the business.

Title: Casino
Plots: In Las Vegas, two best friends - a casino executive and a mafia enforcer - compete for a gambling empire and a fast-living, fast-loving socialite.

Title: Ran
Plots: In Medieval Japan, an elderly warlord retires, handing over his empire to his three sons. However, he vastly underestimates how the new-found power will corrupt them and cause them to turn on each other...and him.

Title: Jurassic Park
Plots: A pragmatic paleontologist touring an almost complete theme park on an island in Central America is tasked with protecting a couple of kids after a power failure causes the park's cloned dinosaurs to run loose.

Title: The Sixth Sense
Plots: Malcolm Crowe, a child psychologist, starts treating a young boy, Cole, who encounters dead people and convinces him to help them. In turn, Cole helps Malcolm reconcile with his estranged wife.

Title: Pan's Labyrinth
Plots: In the Falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.

Title: Unforgiven
Plots: Retired Old West gunslinger William Munny reluctantly takes on one last job, with the help of his old partner Ned Logan and a young man, The "Schofield Kid."

Title: No Country for Old Men
Plots: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon the aftermath of a drug deal gone wrong and over two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.

Title: A Beautiful Mind
Plots: A mathematical genius, John Nash made an astonishing discovery early in his career and stood on the brink of international acclaim. But the handsome and arrogant Nash soon found himself on a harrowing journey of self-discovery.

Title: The Thing
Plots: A research team in Antarctica is hunted by a shape-shifting alien that assumes the appearance of its victims.

Title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre
Plots: Two down-on-their-luck Americans searching for work in 1920s Mexico convince an old prospector to help them mine for gold in the Sierra Madre Mountains.

Title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
Plots: After awakening from a four-year coma, a former assassin wreaks vengeance on the team of assassins who betrayed her.

Title: Yojimbo
Plots: A crafty ronin comes to a town divided by two criminal gangs and decides to play them against each other to free the town.

Title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Plots: King Arthur and his Knights of the Round Table embark on a surreal, low-budget search for the Holy Grail, encountering many, very silly obstacles.

Title: The Great Escape
Plots: Allied prisoners of war plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.

Title: Finding Nemo
Plots: After his son is captured in the Great Barrier Reef and taken to Sydney, a timid clownfish sets out on a journey to bring him home.

Title: Rashomon
Plots: The rape of a bride and the murder of her samurai husband are recalled from the perspectives of a bandit, the bride, the samurai's ghost and a woodcutter.

Title: Prisoners
Plots: When Keller Dover's daughter and her friend go missing, he takes matters into his own hands as the police pursue multiple leads and the pressure mounts.

Title: Howl's Moving Castle
Plots: When an unconfident young woman is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking castle.

Title: The Elephant Man
Plots: A Victorian surgeon rescues a heavily disfigured man who is mistreated while scraping a living as a side-show freak. Behind his monstrous façade, there is revealed a person of kindness, intelligence and sophistication.

Title: Chinatown
Plots: A private detective hired to expose an adulterer in 1930s Los Angeles finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption, and murder.

Title: Dial M for Murder
Plots: A former tennis star arranges the murder of his adulterous wife.

Title: Gone with the Wind
Plots: A sheltered and manipulative Southern belle and a roguish profiteer face off in a turbulent romance as the society around them crumbles with the end of slavery and is rebuilt during the Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

Title: V for Vendetta
Plots: In a future British dystopian society, a shadowy freedom fighter, known only by the alias of "V", plots to overthrow the tyrannical government - with the help of a young woman.

Title: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
Plots: Eddy persuades his three pals to pool money for a vital poker game against a powerful local mobster, Hatchet Harry. Eddy loses, after which Harry gives him a week to pay back 500,000 pounds.

Title: The Secret in Their Eyes
Plots: A retired legal counselor writes a novel hoping to find closure for one of his past unresolved homicide cases and for his unreciprocated love with his superior - both of which still haunt him decades later.

Title: Inside Out
Plots: After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school.

Title: Raging Bull
Plots: The life of boxer Jake LaMotta, whose violence and temper that led him to the top in the ring destroyed his life outside of it.

Title: Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri
Plots: A mother personally challenges the local authorities to solve her daughter's murder when they fail to catch the culprit.

Title: Trainspotting
Plots: Renton, deeply immersed in the Edinburgh drug scene, tries to clean up and get out despite the allure of drugs and the influence of friends.

Title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
Plots: British POWs are forced to build a railway bridge across the river Kwai for their Japanese captors in occupied Burma, not knowing that the allied forces are planning a daring commando raid through the jungle to destroy it.

Title: Spider-Man: No Way Home
Plots: With Spider-Man's identity now revealed, Peter asks Doctor Strange for help. When a spell goes wrong, dangerous foes from other worlds start to appear, forcing Peter to discover what it truly means to be Spider-Man.

Title: Fargo
Plots: Minnesota car salesman Jerry Lundegaard's inept crime falls apart due to his and his henchmen's bungling and the persistent police work of the quite pregnant Marge Gunderson.

Title: Klaus
Plots: A simple act of kindness always sparks another, even in a frozen, faraway place. When Smeerensburg's new postman, Jesper, befriends toymaker Klaus, their gifts melt an age-old feud and deliver a sleigh full of holiday traditions.

Title: Warrior
Plots: The youngest son of an alcoholic former boxer returns home, where he's trained by his father for competition in a mixed martial arts tournament - a path that puts the fighter on a collision course with his estranged, older brother.

Title: Catch Me If You Can
Plots: Barely 17 yet, Frank is a skilled forger who has passed as a doctor, lawyer and pilot. FBI agent Carl becomes obsessed with tracking down the con man, who only revels in the pursuit.

Title: Godzilla Minus One
Plots: Post war Japan is at its lowest point when a new crisis emerges in the form of a giant monster, baptized in the horrific power of the atomic bomb.

Title: Gran Torino
Plots: After a Hmong teenager tries to steal his prized 1972 Gran Torino, a disgruntled, prejudiced Korean War veteran seeks to redeem both the boy and himself.

Title: My Neighbour Totoro
Plots: When two girls move to the country to be near their ailing mother, they have adventures with the wondrous forest spirits who live nearby.

Title: Million Dollar Baby
Plots: Frankie, an ill-tempered old coach, reluctantly agrees to train aspiring boxer Maggie. Impressed with her determination and talent, he helps her become the best and the two soon form a close bond.

Title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2
Plots: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

Title: Children of Heaven
Plots: After a boy loses his sister's pair of shoes, he goes on a series of adventures in order to find them. When he can't, he tries a new way to "win" a new pair.

Title: 12 Years a Slave
Plots: In the antebellum United States, Solomon Northup, a free Black man from upstate New York, is abducted and sold into slavery.

Title: Blade Runner
Plots: A blade runner must pursue and terminate four replicants who stole a ship in space and have returned to Earth to find their creator.

Title: Before Sunrise
Plots: A young man and woman meet on a train in Europe, and wind up spending one evening together in Vienna. Unfortunately, both know that this will probably be their only night together.

Title: Ben-Hur
Plots: After a Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend in 1st-century Jerusalem, he regains his freedom and comes back for revenge.

Title: The Grand Budapest Hotel
Plots: A writer encounters the owner of an aging high-class hotel, who tells him of his early years serving as a lobby boy in the hotel's glorious years under an exceptional concierge.

Title: Barry Lyndon
Plots: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.

Title: Gone Girl
Plots: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.

Title: Hacksaw Ridge
Plots: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, serving during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.

Title: The Gold Rush
Plots: A prospector goes to the Klondike during the 1890s gold rush in hopes of making his fortune, and is smitten with a girl he sees in a dance hall.

Title: Memories of Murder
Plots: In a small Korean province in 1986, two detectives struggle with the case of multiple young women being found raped and murdered by an unknown culprit.

Title: In the Name of the Father
Plots: An Irish man's coerced confession to an I.R.A. bombing he did not commit results in the imprisonment of his father as well. Meanwhile, a British lawyer fights to clear their names and free them.

Title: Dead Poets Society
Plots: Maverick teacher John Keating returns in 1959 to the prestigious New England boys' boarding school where he was once a star student, using poetry to embolden his pupils to new heights of self-expression.

Title: On the Waterfront
Plots: An ex-prize fighter turned New Jersey longshoreman struggles to stand up to his corrupt union bosses, including his older brother, as he starts to connect with the grieving sister of one of the syndicate's victims.

Title: The General
Plots: After being rejected by the Confederate military, not realizing it was due to his crucial civilian role, an engineer must single-handedly recapture his beloved locomotive after it is seized by Union spies and return it through enemy lines.

Title: The Deer Hunter
Plots: An in-depth examination of the ways in which the Vietnam War impacts and disrupts the lives of several friends in a small steel mill town in Pennsylvania.

Title: Wild Tales
Plots: Six short stories that explore the extremities of human behavior involving people in distress.

Title: Mad Max: Fury Road
Plots: In a post-apocalyptic wasteland, a woman rebels against a tyrannical ruler in search for her homeland with the aid of a group of female prisoners, a psychotic worshiper and a drifter named Max.

Title: Monsters, Inc.
Plots: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

Title: Sherlock Jr.
Plots: A film projectionist longs to be a detective, and puts his meagre skills to work when he is framed by a rival for stealing his girlfriend's father's pocketwatch.

Title: The Third Man
Plots: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.

Title: Wild Strawberries
Plots: After living a life marked by coldness, an aging professor is forced to confront the emptiness of his existence.

Title: The Wages of Fear
Plots: In a decrepit South American village, four men are hired to transport an urgent nitroglycerine shipment without the equipment that would make it safe.

Title: Jaws
Plots: When a killer shark unleashes chaos on a beach community off Cape Cod, it's up to a local sheriff, a marine biologist, and an old seafarer to hunt the beast down.

Title: How to Train Your Dragon
Plots: A hapless young Viking who aspires to hunt dragons becomes the unlikely friend of a young dragon himself, and learns there may be more to the creatures than he assumed.

Title: Mary and Max
Plots: In 1976 Melbourne, a lonely 8-year-old girl strikes up a correspondence with an unlikely pen pal: a severely obese 44-year-old New Yorker with Asperger's syndrome.

Title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
Plots: A naive youth leader is appointed to fill a vacancy in the U.S. Senate. His idealistic plans promptly collide with corruption at home and subterfuge from his hero in Washington, but he tries to forge ahead despite attacks on his character.

Title: Ratatouille
Plots: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous Paris restaurant.

Title: Le Mans '66
Plots: American car designer Carroll Shelby and driver Ken Miles battle corporate interference and the laws of physics to build a revolutionary race car for Ford in order to defeat Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1966.

Title: The Big Lebowski
Plots: Jeff "The Dude" Lebowski, mistaken for a millionaire of the same name, seeks restitution for his ruined rug and enlists his bowling buddies to help get it.

Title: Room
Plots: A little boy is held captive in a room with his mother since his birth, so he has never known the world outside.

Title: Tokyo Story
Plots: An old couple visit their children and grandchildren in the city, but receive little attention.

Title: The Seventh Seal
Plots: A knight returning to Sweden after the Crusades seeks answers about life, death, and the existence of God as he plays chess against the Grim Reaper during the Black Plague.

Title: Rocky
Plots: A small-time Philadelphia boxer gets a supremely rare chance to fight the world heavyweight champion in a bout in which he strives to go the distance for his self-respect.

Title: Logan
Plots: In a future where mutants are nearly extinct, an elderly and weary Logan leads a quiet life. But when Laura, a mutant child pursued by scientists, comes to him for help, he must get her to safety.

Title: Spotlight
Plots: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.

Title: Hotel Rwanda
Plots: Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager, houses over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda, Africa.

Title: Platoon
Plots: Chris Taylor, a neophyte recruit in Vietnam, finds himself caught in a battle of wills between two sergeants, one good and the other evil. A shrewd examination of the brutality of war and the duality of man in conflict.

Title: The Terminator
Plots: A human soldier is sent from 2029 to 1984 to stop an almost indestructible cyborg killing machine, sent from the same year, which has been programmed to execute a young woman whose unborn son is the key to humanity's future salvation.

Title: The Passion of Joan of Arc
Plots: In 1431, Jeanne d'Arc is placed on trial on charges of heresy. The ecclesiastical jurists attempt to force Jeanne to recant her claims of holy visions.

Title: Before Sunset
Plots: Nine years after Jesse and Celine first met, they encounter each other again on the French leg of Jesse's book tour.

Title: La haine
Plots: 24 hours in the lives of three young men in the French suburbs the day after a violent riot.

Title: The Best Years of Our Lives
Plots: Three World War II veterans, two of them traumatized or disabled, return home to the American midwest to discover that they and their families have been irreparably changed.

Title: The Exorcist
Plots: When a young girl is possessed by a mysterious entity, her mother seeks the help of two Catholic priests to save her life.

Title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
Plots: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.

Title: Rush
Plots: The merciless 1970s rivalry between Formula One rivals James Hunt and Niki Lauda.

Title: Jai Bhim
Plots: When a tribal man is arrested for a case of alleged theft, his wife turns to a human-rights lawyer to help bring justice.

Title: Network
Plots: A television network cynically exploits a deranged former anchor's ravings and revelations about the news media for its own profit, but finds that his message may be difficult to control.

Title: Stand by Me
Plots: A writer recounts a childhood journey with his friends to find the body of a missing boy.

Title: The Wizard of Oz
Plots: Young Dorothy Gale and her dog Toto are swept away by a tornado from their Kansas farm to the magical Land of Oz, and embark on a quest with three new friends to see the Wizard, who can return her to her home and fulfill the others' wishes.

Title: The Incredibles
Plots: While trying to lead a quiet suburban life, a family of undercover superheroes are forced into action to save the world.

Title: Hachi: A Dog's Tale
Plots: Professor Wilson discovers a lost Akita puppy on his way home. Despite objections from his wife, Hachi endears himself to the family and grows to be Parker's loyal companion. As their bond grows deeper, a beautiful relationship unfolds.

Title: The Handmaiden
Plots: A woman is hired as a handmaiden to a Japanese heiress, but secretly she is involved in a plot to defraud her.

Title: Into the Wild
Plots: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.

Title: My Father and My Son
Plots: The family of a left-wing journalist is torn apart after the military coup of Turkey in 1980.

Title: The Sound of Music
Plots: A young novice is sent by her convent in 1930s Austria to become a governess to the seven children of a widowed naval officer.

Title: To Be or Not to Be
Plots: During the German occupation of Poland, an acting troupe becomes embroiled in a Polish soldier's efforts to track down a German spy.

Title: The Grapes of Wrath
Plots: An Oklahoma family, driven off their farm by the poverty and hopelessness of the Dust Bowl, joins the westward migration to California, suffering the misfortunes of the homeless in the Great Depression.

Title: The Battle of Algiers
Plots: In the 1950s, fear and violence escalate as the people of Algiers fight for independence from the French government.

Title: Groundhog Day
Plots: A narcissistic, self-centered weatherman finds himself in a time loop on Groundhog Day.

Title: Amores perros
Plots: An amateur dog fighter, a supermodel, and a derelict assassin, all separately struggling to find love, find their lives transformed by a devastating car wreck in Mexico City.

Title: Rebecca
Plots: A self-conscious woman juggles adjusting to her new role as an aristocrat's wife and avoiding being intimidated by his first wife's spectral presence.

Title: Cool Hand Luke
Plots: A laid-back Southern man is sentenced to two years in a rural prison, but refuses to conform.

Title: The Iron Giant
Plots: A young boy befriends a giant robot from outer space that a paranoid government agent wants to destroy.

Title: The Help
Plots: An aspiring author during the civil rights movement of the 1960s decides to write a book detailing the African American maids' point of view on the white families for which they work, and the hardships they go through on a daily basis.

Title: It Happened One Night
Plots: A renegade reporter trailing a young runaway heiress for a big story joins her on a bus heading from Florida to New York, and they end up stuck with each other when the bus leaves them behind at one of the stops.

Title: Aladdin
Plots: A kind-hearted street urchin and a power-hungry Grand Vizier vie for a magic lamp that has the power to make their deepest wishes come true.

Title: Dances with Wolves
Plots: Lieutenant John Dunbar, assigned to a remote western Civil War outpost, finds himself engaging with a neighbouring Sioux settlement, causing him to question his own purpose.

Title: Paris, Texas
Plots: Travis Henderson, an aimless drifter who has been missing for four years, wanders out of the desert and must reconnect with society, himself, his life, and his family.
